values.description:
While testing [release-tools PR 565](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/565/install-libignition-tools-dev-where-needed/diff), I noticed that the ign_TEST wasn't running. So I've fixed the test logic here and cleaned up a bit using the `ign_get_libsources_and_unittests` helper from ign-cmake.

I also added the use of `PROJECT_LIBRARY_TARGET_NAME` in one place and fixed a test name.
values.title: Fix ign_TEST cmake logic, use ign-cmake helpers

summary.raw:
While testing [release-tools PR 565](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/565/install-libignition-tools-dev-where-needed/diff), I noticed that the ign_TEST wasn't running. So I've fixed the test logic here and cleaned up a bit using the `ign_get_libsources_and_unittests` helper from ign-cmake.

I also added the use of `PROJECT_LIBRARY_TARGET_NAME` in one place and fixed a test name.
summary.html:
While testing release-tools PR 565, I noticed that the ign_TEST wasn't running. So I've fixed the test logic here and cleaned up a bit using the ign_get_libsources_and_unittests helper from ign-cmake.

I also added the use of PROJECT_LIBRARY_TARGET_NAME in one place and fixed a test name.

values.description:
Address issue #26 by only generating widgets when their parent collapsible is expanded.

 * Functions which set/get property value or state will now fail unless the property has been generated (i.e. their parent expanded)
* Added a `ToggleAll` function to conveniently generate all widgets and get the old behaviour
* There's a lot of room for improvement, there are a few places where the whole widget is updated at once, but that could be localized only for the current nested message. Future work.
values.title: MessageWidget on demand

summary.raw:
Address issue #26 by only generating widgets when their parent collapsible is expanded.

 * Functions which set/get property value or state will now fail unless the property has been generated (i.e. their parent expanded)
* Added a `ToggleAll` function to conveniently generate all widgets and get the old behaviour
* There's a lot of room for improvement, there are a few places where the whole widget is updated at once, but that could be localized only for the current nested message. Future work.
summary.html:
Address issue #26 by only generating widgets when their parent collapsible is expanded.

  • Functions which set/get property value or state will now fail unless the property has been generated (i.e. their parent expanded)
  • Added a ToggleAll function to conveniently generate all widgets and get the old behaviour
  • There's a lot of room for improvement, there are a few places where the whole widget is updated at once, but that could be localized only for the current nested message. Future work.

values.description:
This pull request modifies the title of the collapsible widgets in the `MessageWidget` plugin under some circumstances. When we're populating a repeated list of widgets and the child contains a `name` field, its value will be used instead of a numeric index.

![tree_widgets_with_names.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3538237312-tree_widgets_with_names.png)

Thanks to @chapulina for the help.
values.title: Rename collapsible elements when they're named

summary.raw:
This pull request modifies the title of the collapsible widgets in the `MessageWidget` plugin under some circumstances. When we're populating a repeated list of widgets and the child contains a `name` field, its value will be used instead of a numeric index.

![tree_widgets_with_names.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3538237312-tree_widgets_with_names.png)

Thanks to @chapulina for the help.
summary.html:
This pull request modifies the title of the collapsible widgets in the MessageWidget plugin under some circumstances. When we're populating a repeated list of widgets and the child contains a name field, its value will be used instead of a numeric index.

Thanks to @chapulina for the help.

values.description:
Merging `qml_pure` into `qml_pure_ian`. These should work:

---
## Insert from menu

`ign gui -v 4`

![insertscene3d.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4040669813-insertscene3d.gif)

---
## Standalone

`ign gui -v 4 -s Scene3D`

![scene3dstandalone.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/372592961-scene3dstandalone.png)

---
## Config file

`ign gui -v 4 -c examples/config/scene3d.config`

(note that they start stacked on top of each other for now, but they can be dragged

![scene3dconfig.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3384223153-scene3dconfig.png)

values.description:
This is a work in progress. We will probably merge this pull request in some unfinished state and continue from there, the approach I'm taking is:

* Remove anything which isn't needed anymore, such as the need to link to and include anything related to `QWidgets`
* Remove old functionality as it is implemented with the new approach
* Comment out functionality which doesn't work anymore, and hasn't been migrated yet, this includes several classes, plugins and tests
* Roughly converting a few plugins just to test the high level functionality and get familiar with QtQuick, without caring about usability for now

---

## What should work

* All command line tools

* Running an empty window, for example:

    * `ign gui`
    * `ign gui -v 4`

* Running a standalone plugin, for example:

    * `ign gui -s Publisher`
    * `ign gui -s TopicEcho`

* Running a config file, for example:

    * `ign gui -c examples/config/pubsub.config`

* The plugin example under `examples/plugin/hello_world`

* All uncommented tests

---

I'm not going to write a lot about what has been done because great part of it is still subject to change. Feel free to ask about any details.
values.title: [WIP] Migrate to QtQuick

values.description:
## Problem

When a `Scene3D` plugin is inserted, there's a chance a black box will appear around some item in the UI. Observations:

1. Sometimes there's no black box at all
1. When there is a black box, it's only one
1. The black box always appears around and is attached to one of these items:
    * plugin card

        ![black_card.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3617105192-black_card.gif)

    * card's toolbar

        ![blackcardtb.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2133830255-blackcardtb.png)

    * window toolbar
 
        ![blacktb.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2437491727-blacktb.png)


## Solution

I'm hopeful that we may tweak what we're doing with OpenGL to eventually re-enable shadows. For now the solutions are to either:

1. Use a style other than material, for example:

        QT_QUICK_CONTROLS_STYLE=universal ign gui -v 4 -c ../examples/config/scene3d.config

1. Disable shadows for material, as this PR does


(FYI @iche033)
values.title: [gz11] Disable material design shadows - interferes with Ogre

summary.raw:
## Problem

When a `Scene3D` plugin is inserted, there's a chance a black box will appear around some item in the UI. Observations:

1. Sometimes there's no black box at all
1. When there is a black box, it's only one
1. The black box always appears around and is attached to one of these items:
    * plugin card

        ![black_card.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3617105192-black_card.gif)

    * card's toolbar

        ![blackcardtb.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2133830255-blackcardtb.png)

    * window toolbar
 
        ![blacktb.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2437491727-blacktb.png)


## Solution

I'm hopeful that we may tweak what we're doing with OpenGL to eventually re-enable shadows. For now the solutions are to either:

1. Use a style other than material, for example:

        QT_QUICK_CONTROLS_STYLE=universal ign gui -v 4 -c ../examples/config/scene3d.config

1. Disable shadows for material, as this PR does


(FYI @iche033)
summary.html:
Problem

When a Scene3D plugin is inserted, there's a chance a black box will appear around some item in the UI. Observations:

  1. Sometimes there's no black box at all
  2. When there is a black box, it's only one

  3. The black box always appears around and is attached to one of these items:

    • plugin card

    • card's toolbar

    • window toolbar

Solution

I'm hopeful that we may tweak what we're doing with OpenGL to eventually re-enable shadows. For now the solutions are to either:

  1. Use a style other than material, for example:

    QT_QUICK_CONTROLS_STYLE=universal ign gui -v 4 -c ../examples/config/scene3d.config

  2. Disable shadows for material, as this PR does

(FYI @iche033)

values.description:
* Rename `MainWindow.qml` to `Main.qml` so it doesn't overlap the C++ class
* Rename `Dialog.qml` so it doesn't overlap with the C++ class and the default Dialog component
* Take `PluginMenu` and `SideDrawer` from `Main` into their own components
* Swap the options on the menu and the drawer

![menus.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/1776591988-menus.gif)
values.title: [gz11] Split some QML components and swap menus

summary.raw:
* Rename `MainWindow.qml` to `Main.qml` so it doesn't overlap the C++ class
* Rename `Dialog.qml` so it doesn't overlap with the C++ class and the default Dialog component
* Take `PluginMenu` and `SideDrawer` from `Main` into their own components
* Swap the options on the menu and the drawer

![menus.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/1776591988-menus.gif)
summary.html:
• Rename MainWindow.qml to Main.qml so it doesn't overlap the C++ class
  • Rename Dialog.qml so it doesn't overlap with the C++ class and the default Dialog component
  • Take PluginMenu and SideDrawer from Main into their own components
  • Swap the options on the menu and the drawer

values.description:
* `MainWindow`'s slots are now public so that the QML can call them. This means the tests can also directly call them and skip the action search on the menus. Stylesheet-related tests will be commented out until there is an example on how to change the styling in QML.
* `Plugin_TEST` just works, so it's enabled
* Enabled several `Iface` tests, still left:
    * stylesheet-related
    * menu-related
    * multiple standalone dialogs
values.title: [gz11] More tests (MainWindow, Plugin, Iface)

summary.raw:
* `MainWindow`'s slots are now public so that the QML can call them. This means the tests can also directly call them and skip the action search on the menus. Stylesheet-related tests will be commented out until there is an example on how to change the styling in QML.
* `Plugin_TEST` just works, so it's enabled
* Enabled several `Iface` tests, still left:
    * stylesheet-related
    * menu-related
    * multiple standalone dialogs
summary.html:
• MainWindow's slots are now public so that the QML can call them. This means the tests can also directly call them and skip the action search on the menus. Stylesheet-related tests will be commented out until there is an example on how to change the styling in QML.
  • Plugin_TEST just works, so it's enabled
  • Enabled several Iface tests, still left:
    • stylesheet-related
    • menu-related
    • multiple standalone dialogs

values.description:
Remove `Iface` and move its functionality to `Application`, which subclasses `QGuiApplication`.

This uses the fact that Qt enforces a single application per process, which is a singleton accessible from other classes. Also make better use of Qt's API to get windows and dialogs in the app.

This is a first pass. I also want to see how much of the `MainWindow` class I can merge with `Application`. There are functions I was putting there just because it was a `QObject`, while `Iface` wasn't.

This PR includes the test fixes from ~~pull request #127~~ (merged), but migrated to use the new class.
values.title: [gz11] Application

summary.raw:
Remove `Iface` and move its functionality to `Application`, which subclasses `QGuiApplication`.

This uses the fact that Qt enforces a single application per process, which is a singleton accessible from other classes. Also make better use of Qt's API to get windows and dialogs in the app.

This is a first pass. I also want to see how much of the `MainWindow` class I can merge with `Application`. There are functions I was putting there just because it was a `QObject`, while `Iface` wasn't.

This PR includes the test fixes from ~~pull request #127~~ (merged), but migrated to use the new class.
summary.html:
Remove Iface and move its functionality to Application, which subclasses QGuiApplication.

This uses the fact that Qt enforces a single application per process, which is a singleton accessible from other classes. Also make better use of Qt's API to get windows and dialogs in the app.

This is a first pass. I also want to see how much of the MainWindow class I can merge with Application. There are functions I was putting there just because it was a QObject, while Iface wasn't.

This PR includes the test fixes from pull request #127 (merged), but migrated to use the new class.

values.description:
Builds on top of pull request #128

---

Remove everything related to QSS stylesheets and use QtQuick Controls 2 Styles instead.

See tutorial for documentation.

This is an initial implementation, some possible future features:

* First-class support for Default and Universal styles
* Command line arguments
* Examples setting style from C++

---

Demo:

![styles_opt.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/1625201647-styles_opt.gif)

fixes these warnings:

    [GUI] [Wrn] [Iface.cc:170] [QT] QQmlApplicationEngine failed to load component
    [GUI] [Wrn] [Iface.cc:170] [QT] qrc:qml/Main.qml:200 Type FileDialog unavailable
    file:///usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/qt5/qml/QtQuick/Dialogs/DefaultFileDialog.qml:48 module "Qt.labs.settings" is not installed

 even though tests are not run on pipelines, I’m just adding it to keep track of the qml module dependencies

values.description:
Avoid this error when having both gui0 and gui1:

~~~
Configuration error: File [/usr/local/share/ignition//gui1.yaml] contains a command already registered by ignition-gui0.
~~~
values.title: [gz11] Fix command line versions

summary.raw:
Avoid this error when having both gui0 and gui1:

~~~

values.description:
This is the first of a few PRs towards a widget that allows for toggling/configuring of various “displays”.

‌

There is more context about what PRs are to follow in [this meta-ticket](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31) \(to give an idea of what is in/out of scope for this PR\).

‌

There's an example of the widget in `display_plugins.config`added in this PR. There are two example display plugins in this PR:

* `GridDisplay`:

    * uses the code from the `Grid3d` plugin, but that plugin is more for introspecting/adding multiple grids, while the `GridDisplay` just manages a single grid.
    * has configurable properties specific to grids, in addition to the default visibility checkbox for display plugins.
    
* `RealtimeFactorDisplay`:

    * uses some code from the `TimePanel` plugin, but it paints the RTF on the scene instead of displaying it in the widget \(a feature request from the client\).
    * is not very practical at the moment because it always displays the RTF at the origin of the world as opposed to as an Overlay, but it is an example of a display that does not have any custom configurable properties.
    * has loading issues in some situations \(e.g. the `display_plugins.config`example\). In other cases it loads fine. Resolved in [bdf7b019](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/bdf7b01995aee9a4e2cd428c786010e1d1c288aa?at=default)
    

‌

I have tried to match the existing layout/practices of the source code: I added the `DisplayPlugin` baseclass where the `Plugin` class was but can move it into the `displays` directory if appropriate.

Some screenshots of the state as of 9 July \(enhancements to the appearance targeted as a followup, this PR is for minimum technical functionality\):

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2185918808-displays_widget1.jpg)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2682750443-displays_widget2.jpg)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3571883484-displays_widget3.jpg)
‌
values.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins

    * is not very practical at the moment because it always displays the RTF at the origin of the world as opposed to as an Overlay, but it is an example of a display that does not have any custom configurable properties.

summary.html:
This is the first of a few PRs towards a widget that allows for toggling/configuring of various “displays”.

‌

There is more context about what PRs are to follow in this meta-ticket (to give an idea of what is in/out of scope for this PR).

‌

There's an example of the widget in display_plugins.configadded in this PR. There are two example display plugins in this PR:

  • GridDisplay:

    • uses the code from the Grid3d plugin, but that plugin is more for introspecting/adding multiple grids, while the GridDisplay just manages a single grid.
    • has configurable properties specific to grids, in addition to the default visibility checkbox for display plugins.

  • RealtimeFactorDisplay:

    • uses some code from the TimePanel plugin, but it paints the RTF on the scene instead of displaying it in the widget (a feature request from the client).
    • is not very practical at the moment because it always displays the RTF at the origin of the world as opposed to as an Overlay, but it is an example of a display that does not have any custom configurable properties.
    • has loading issues in some situations (e.g. the display_plugins.configexample). In other cases it loads fine. Resolved in bdf7b019

‌

I have tried to match the existing layout/practices of the source code: I added the DisplayPlugin baseclass where the Plugin class was but can move it into the displays directory if appropriate.

values.description:
Addresses issue #32

Try:

`ign gui --force-version 0.1.0 -c test/config/huge_window.config`


---

I don't think it's common for applications to prevent users from dragging the window borders beyond the desktop borders if the window manager allows that (I often expand windows across workspaces on Ubuntu for example). So this PR is just preventing the initial size to be larger than the screen, which may happen when sharing config files across computers.
values.title: Clamp window size to fit screen

summary.raw:
Addresses issue #32

Try:

`ign gui --force-version 0.1.0 -c test/config/huge_window.config`


---

I don't think it's common for applications to prevent users from dragging the window borders beyond the desktop borders if the window manager allows that (I often expand windows across workspaces on Ubuntu for example). So this PR is just preventing the initial size to be larger than the screen, which may happen when sharing config files across computers.
summary.html:
Addresses issue #32

Try:

ign gui --force-version 0.1.0 -c test/config/huge_window.config

I don't think it's common for applications to prevent users from dragging the window borders beyond the desktop borders if the window manager allows that (I often expand windows across workspaces on Ubuntu for example). So this PR is just preventing the initial size to be larger than the screen, which may happen when sharing config files across computers.

values.reason: I'm declining this PR because an application is allowed to be larger than a desktop. A config file that contains dimensions larger than a desktop size is okay.

values.description:
Display plugins can’t be run standalone, they need to be loaded into the Displays plugin. As such, this PR gets rid of temporary shortcuts where display plugins were piggybacking on properties of standard GUI plugins in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/137](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/137):

‌

* DisplayPlugins are now registered as such and not as standard GUI Plugins.
* They are installed in a different directory so they will no longer show in the `Plugins` dropdown menu on MainWindow.
* Before, they were being loaded leveraging `loadPlugin` in Iface, and then casting the loaded gui plugin to a display plugin. Now, the common functionality in `loadPlugin` that is useful for loading both `ignition::gui::Plugin`s and `ignition::gui::DisplayPlugin`s has been factored out into `instantiateCommonPlugin`. `loadPlugin` and `loadDisplayPlugin` wrap `instantiateCommonPlugin` with things specific to their classes: where to look for the plugins before calling `instantiateCommonPlugin`, and how to initialise them afterwards.
* DisplayPlugin doesn’t inherit from Plugin anymore.
values.title: DisplayPlugin loading not piggybacking on standard GUI plugin loading

summary.raw:
Display plugins can’t be run standalone, they need to be loaded into the Displays plugin. As such, this PR gets rid of temporary shortcuts where display plugins were piggybacking on properties of standard GUI plugins in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/137](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/137):

‌

* DisplayPlugins are now registered as such and not as standard GUI Plugins.
* They are installed in a different directory so they will no longer show in the `Plugins` dropdown menu on MainWindow.
* Before, they were being loaded leveraging `loadPlugin` in Iface, and then casting the loaded gui plugin to a display plugin. Now, the common functionality in `loadPlugin` that is useful for loading both `ignition::gui::Plugin`s and `ignition::gui::DisplayPlugin`s has been factored out into `instantiateCommonPlugin`. `loadPlugin` and `loadDisplayPlugin` wrap `instantiateCommonPlugin` with things specific to their classes: where to look for the plugins before calling `instantiateCommonPlugin`, and how to initialise them afterwards.
* DisplayPlugin doesn’t inherit from Plugin anymore.
summary.html:
Display plugins can’t be run standalone, they need to be loaded into the Displays plugin. As such, this PR gets rid of temporary shortcuts where display plugins were piggybacking on properties of standard GUI plugins in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/137:

‌

  • DisplayPlugins are now registered as such and not as standard GUI Plugins.
  • They are installed in a different directory so they will no longer show in the Plugins dropdown menu on MainWindow.
  • Before, they were being loaded leveraging loadPlugin in Iface, and then casting the loaded gui plugin to a display plugin. Now, the common functionality in loadPlugin that is useful for loading both ignition::gui::Plugins and ignition::gui::DisplayPlugins has been factored out into instantiateCommonPlugin. loadPlugin and loadDisplayPlugin wrap instantiateCommonPlugin with things specific to their classes: where to look for the plugins before calling instantiateCommonPlugin, and how to initialise them afterwards.
  • DisplayPlugin doesn’t inherit from Plugin anymore.

values.description:
For some reason our bash tool to parse the Bitbucket pipelines does not like the way of declaring dependencies in this repository. After grouping some of them in the same line, it is working. 

* Failing: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition\_gui-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/5/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/5/)
* Working: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition\_gui-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/16/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/16/)
values.title: Workaround for getting a bash parseable bitbucket-pipelines yaml file

summary.raw:
For some reason our bash tool to parse the Bitbucket pipelines does not like the way of declaring dependencies in this repository. After grouping some of them in the same line, it is working. 

* Failing: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition\_gui-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/5/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/5/)
* Working: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition\_gui-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/16/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/16/)
summary.html:
For some reason our bash tool to parse the Bitbucket pipelines does not like the way of declaring dependencies in this repository. After grouping some of them in the same line, it is working.

  • Failing: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/5/
  • Working: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/16/

values.description:
Loading configs

* Default config tags of ‘visible’, ‘scene’ and ‘title’ will be parsed by all display plugins individually in the DisplayPlugin base class' `Load` \(not ‘engine’ because ogre is required at the moment, e.g. because of [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/69](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/69/add-setvisible-for-visual/diff)\)
* Custom configs can be passed through to display plugins via their `Initialize` method. GridDisplay, for example, can have the colour etc of its grid customised.

Saving configs

* General config properties are saved in `DisplayPlugin::Config`
* Custom configs can be saved by specifying e.g. `GridDisplay::CustomConfig`.

Tests have been added to check that the same state of e.g. GridDisplay can be reloaded after modifying the grid’s properties.
values.title: Loading/saving of display plugin configs

* Custom configs can be passed through to display plugins via their `Initialize` method. GridDisplay, for example, can have the colour etc of its grid customised.

Saving configs

* General config properties are saved in `DisplayPlugin::Config`
* Custom configs can be saved by specifying e.g. `GridDisplay::CustomConfig`.

Tests have been added to check that the same state of e.g. GridDisplay can be reloaded after modifying the grid’s properties.

  • Default config tags of ‘visible’, ‘scene’ and ‘title’ will be parsed by all display plugins individually in the DisplayPlugin base class' Load (not ‘engine’ because ogre is required at the moment, e.g. because of #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/69)
  • Custom configs can be passed through to display plugins via their Initialize method. GridDisplay, for example, can have the colour etc of its grid customised.

Saving configs

  • General config properties are saved in DisplayPlugin::Config
  • Custom configs can be saved by specifying e.g. GridDisplay::CustomConfig.

Tests have been added to check that the same state of e.g. GridDisplay can be reloaded after modifying the grid’s properties.

values.description:
This is just a proof of concept at the moment. It seems like the most straightforward way to get the RTF displayed in the corner of the screen as part of [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31).

‌

It requires a change in ignition rendering to allow a visual to be attached to a camera: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86)

I am yet to make it robust to the dimensions of the camera though.
values.title: Realtime factor display plugin: Attach RTF text to Camera of the Scene
